result.markdown:
---
title: "The Patient Provider Relationship, A Synthetic Social Network"
subtitle: "Network Block Modeling2"
author: "Sue-Ellen Duffy"
date: "2024-04-25"
categories: [code, analysis, block_model]
---

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
library(igraph)
library(sna)
library(intergraph)


library(ggplot2)
library(patchwork)
```
:::


This post will explore the Synthetic Mass network data in more detail.

# Read in Data

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pat_attr <- read_csv("post_one_data/pat_attr.csv", 
    col_types = cols(...1 = col_skip()))
pro_attr <- read_csv("post_one_data/pro_attr.csv", 
    col_types = cols(...1 = col_skip()))
encounters_cleaning <- read_csv("post_one_data//encounters_cleaning.csv", 
    col_types = cols(...1 = col_skip()))
encounter_attributes <- read_csv("post_one_data/encounter_attributes.csv", 
    col_types = cols(...1 = col_skip()))
encounters_el  <- read_csv("post_one_data/encounters_el.csv", 
    col_types = cols(...1 = col_skip()))
encounters_st_3 <- read_csv("post_one_data/encounters.st.3.csv", 
    col_types = cols(...1 = col_skip()))
attribute_list <- read.csv("post_one_data/attribute_list.csv")
```
:::

# Prep Data for Analysis

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#combine pro and pat attr
pat_attr$type <- "PATIENT"
pro_attr$type <- "PROVIDER"
both_attr <- bind_rows(pat_attr, pro_attr)
head(both_attr)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 Ã— 7
  NAME                       GENDER RACE  MARITAL INCOME   AGE type   
  <chr>                      <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  
1 Avril120 Olson653          F      white <NA>    482269    36 PATIENT
2 Norma469 Langosh790        F      white <NA>    190464    25 PATIENT
3 Peggie783 Eichmann909      F      white <NA>     78997    21 PATIENT
4 Ashlie138 Williamson769    F      white M         6472    37 PATIENT
5 Christiane220 Ankunding277 F      white <NA>    141475    24 PATIENT
6 Dione665 O'Kon634          F      white M       482269    36 PATIENT
```
:::
:::


# Create bipartite network with attributes

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
encounters.stat <- network(encounters_el,
                         directed = FALSE,
                         bipartite = TRUE,
                         matrix.type = "edgelist",
                         vertex.attr = attribute_list)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#create igraph
encounters.ig <- graph_from_biadjacency_matrix(encounters.stat)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
encounters.stat2 <- asNetwork(encounters.ig)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
projected_graph <- bipartite_projection(encounters.ig)
provider_matrix <- as.matrix(as_adjacency_matrix(projected_graph$proj2))

provider.stat <- asNetwork(projected_graph$proj2)

provider.se <- equiv.clust(provider_matrix,
 equiv.fun = "sedist",
 method = "hamming",
 mode = "graph",
 cluster.method = "complete")

names(provider.se)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "cluster"        "metric"         "equiv.fun"      "cluster.method"
[5] "glabels"        "plabels"       
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(provider.se, main = "provider")
rect.hclust(provider.se$cluster, k = 12)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](post_4_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
blk_model.provider.org <- blockmodel(provider_matrix,
 provider.se, k = 6)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
 blk_model.provider.org$block.model
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Block 1   Block 2     Block 3    Block 4    Block 5    Block 6
Block 1 0.013527738 0.2995595 0.001762115 0.00715859 0.07929515 0.05286344
Block 2 0.299559471       NaN 0.400000000 1.00000000 1.00000000 1.00000000
Block 3 0.001762115 0.4000000 0.476190476 0.00000000 0.00000000 0.00000000
Block 4 0.007158590 1.0000000 0.000000000 0.75000000 0.00000000 0.37500000
Block 5 0.079295154 1.0000000 0.000000000 0.00000000        NaN 0.00000000
Block 6 0.052863436 1.0000000 0.000000000 0.37500000 0.00000000        NaN
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot.block<-function(x=blk_mod, main=NULL, cex.lab=.00001,show_labels = FALSE){
 plot.sociomatrix(x$blocked.data, labels=list(x$plabels,x$plabels),
 main=main, drawlines = FALSE, cex.lab=cex.lab)
 for (j in 2:length(x$plabels)) if (x$block.membership[j] !=
 x$block.membership[j-1])
 abline(v = j- 0.5, h = j- 0.5, lty = 3, xpd=FALSE)
 }
 
plot.block(blk_model.provider.org, main = "provider")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](post_4_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load the igraph package
library(igraph)

# Create an igraph object from the blockmodel
g <- graph_from_adjacency_matrix(projected_graph$provider, mode = "directed", weighted = FALSE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: The `adjmatrix` argument of `graph_from_adjacency_matrix()` must be a matrix as
of igraph 1.6.0.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Plot the graph without labels
plot(g, layout = layout.fruchterman.reingold, vertex.label = NA, vertex.size = 100, edge.width = 1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](post_4_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#blks <- blockmodeling::optRandomParC(provider_matrix, k=6, rep=10, approaches="ss", blocks="com")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Save the blks object to a file
#saveRDS(blks, "blks_results.rds")

# Later, when you want to use it again, you can read it back into R
blks <- readRDS("blks_results.rds")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# blockmodel with optimized partition
blk_mod <- blockmodel(provider_matrix, blks$best$best1$clu,
                      plabels = rownames(provider_matrix))
# print blockmodel object
blk_mod$block.model
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Block 1   Block 2 Block 3     Block 4     Block 5     Block 6
Block 1 0.800000000 0.0000000     0.6 0.010559006 0.000000000 0.001388889
Block 2 0.000000000 0.6666667     0.0 0.000000000 0.388888889 0.000000000
Block 3 0.600000000 0.0000000     NaN 0.000000000 1.000000000 1.000000000
Block 4 0.010559006 0.0000000     0.0 0.015139752 0.006211180 0.004658385
Block 5 0.000000000 0.3888889     1.0 0.006211180 0.866666667 0.006944444
Block 6 0.001388889 0.0000000     1.0 0.004658385 0.006944444 0.053208138
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot.block(blk_mod, main = "provider",
           cex.lab = .000001)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](post_4_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#assign block membership to vertex attribute
provider.stat%v%"role"<-blk_mod$block.membership[match(provider.stat%v%"vertex.names",blk_mod$plabels)]
#plot network using "role" to color nodes
GGally::ggnet2(provider.stat,
               node.color="role", 
               node.size=sna::degree(provider.stat, gmode="graph"),
               node.alpha = .5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally':
  method from   
  +.gg   ggplot2
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](post_4_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#blks2 <- blockmodeling::optRandomParC(provider_matrix, k=12, rep=10, approaches="ss", blocks="com")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Save the blks2 object to a file
#saveRDS(blks2, "blks2_results.rds")

# Later, when you want to use it again, you can read it back into R
blks2 <- readRDS("blks2_results.rds")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# blockmodel with optimized partition
blks2_mod <- blockmodel(provider_matrix, blks2$best$best1$clu,
                      plabels = rownames(provider_matrix))
# print blockmodel object
blks2_mod$block.model
```

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot.block(blks2_mod, main = "provider2",
           cex.lab = .000001)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](post_4_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#assign block membership to vertex attribute
provider.stat%v%"role2"<-blks2_mod$block.membership[match(provider.stat%v%"vertex.names",blks2_mod$plabels)]
#plot network using "role" to color nodes
GGally::ggnet2(provider.stat,
               node.color="role2", 
               node.size=sna::degree(provider.stat, gmode="graph"),
               node.alpha = .5)
```
